Package space.sunqian.fs.base.option

Interface Option<K,V>

Type Parameters:
K - the key type
V - the value type
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConvertOption
@Immutable public interface Option<K,V>
This interface represents an option with a key and value. For example: 

     //declaration:
     public void start(Option<?, ?>... options){...}

     //usage:
     start(
         Option.of("server", null),
         Option.of("Xms", "1G"),
         Option.of("Xmx", "2G")
     );

    • findOption

      @Nullable static <K, V, O extends Option<K, V>> O findOption(@Nonnull K key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Option<?,?> @Nonnull ... options)
      Finds and returns the first option whose key equals the specified key from the given options, or null if not found. This method will cast returned option to the specified type O.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      V - the value type
      O - the returned option type
      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      options - the given options
      Returns:
      the first option whose key equals the specified key from the given options, or null if not found

    • findValue

      static <V> V findValue(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Option<?,?> @Nonnull ... options)
      Finds the first option whose key equals the specified key from the given options. Returns the value of the found option, or null if not found. This method will cast returned value to the specified type V.
      Type Parameters:
      V - the value type
      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      options - the given options
      Returns:
      the value of the found option, or null if not found

    • containsKey

      static boolean containsKey(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Option<?,?> @Nonnull ... options)
      Returns whether the given options contain an option whose key equals the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      options - the given options
      Returns:
      true if given options contain an option whose key equals the specified key, otherwise false
